New data on heart crystals
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Heart Crystals: Development & Use: New data on heart crystals
By Anonymous on Tuesday, October 9, 2001 - 02:34 pm:

it seems that the monster's forte is shown on the heart crystal. using this dada i found out that whatever bit/orb/stone the forte came from gives you the move for that spieces that comes from that bit/orb/stone. that is if your monster is of a different breed.

By Steel Dragon on Tuesday, October 9, 2001 - 04:08 pm:

The forte all depends on which of the dead monster's techs had the highest level, but then how is the tech of the inheriter of the heart determined? It's determined by what Bit,Stone, or Orb the forte tech is gotten from so if the forte tech is golem's Atomic Fist which is gotten from the Flare Stone the new tech learned would be the flare stone tech of the monster who's getting the heart.

By superbk on Tuesday, October 9, 2001 - 08:34 pm:

hehe I think I was just about to figure this out but you beat me to the draw. congrats on figuring out another of MR3's mysteries.

By Serpentine on Wednesday, October 17, 2001 - 11:32 am:

Well, I recently did a test (this is only my 2nd day playing MR3) using hearts and I gave the heart of my Pixie/??? from the Bladerunner soundtrack (Pris?) to a newborn Golem (the 'castle' variant). The heart displayed the pixie's move that I used the most (Wind Lance) and I believe it was a level 3 move. That is to say, it was NO HIGHER Than a level 3 move. When I took the golem into battle I noticed his rocket punch move was lvl 5! So whoever said that the moves stored in the hearts are the only ones affected by the heart increase may be wrong....


Hope this helps.

By Rim on Wednesday, October 17, 2001 - 12:54 pm:

I have found that when a monster who has the attack based on the same stone. Ie a jade bit attack is the most used and the monster getting the heart already has the attack from a jade bit then giving that heart will cuase that moves level to go up. If the monster doesnt have the move from that item then it will get the move at level one. As far as I can tell giveing a heart affects only one move. Either giving a attack or giving a already existing attack a boost in level.
